reviewText:
Early Access Review

Sector 6 is a nice horizontal shoot-em-up.  With decent controls and lots of ship customization options, this is a great game to have.  I recommend this game to those that are interested.

The game plays like a standard shoot-em-up, move around and shoot.  What differs is that this game has skill slots where you get to use different abilities at the cost of cooldowns.  There are 9 slots as of now and as you play the game you may unlock more and equip them.

There is a campaign, which has missions you need to complete.  It is not all linear though, you are free to complete as many side missions as you want which consists of defeat X number of enemies" and at the end you can earn money
recommended: or xp.\n\nThe other differences are the enemy encounters
hoursPlayed: you don't fight hordes of enemies
voteText: there will be  a much smaller amount like 1-5 depending on the enemy ship type.  Battles feel more "tactical"
helpfulPercent: as in you have to dodge enemy attacks
votesTotal:
and defend.  This gives a feeling of accomplishment and that you earned your victory.


There is also ship customization which I feel is the bread and butter of this game
votesFunny: it is fantastic.  As you play the game you find ship parts that you can use to build and customize your own ship.  You can make it look like anything you want to.  Ship parts also have randomized stats on them that can either boost your damage
column17:
this gives the game a lot of replayablity.


A gripe I have is the current movement system.  It is a bit "Jerky" and doesn't feel to smooth.  But this is minor and is subject to change in future updates.

From a hours to price ratio
column18: you will definietly get your money's worth
column19: or at least break even.  Enjoyable game with loot and ship customizing
column20: can't really go wrong.  I hope this review was helpful."
column24: 20 of 23 people (87%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Sector Six is a spectacular mash-up of light rpg and strategy elements fused with a side scrolling shoot 'em up. Upgrading your ship's modules and weapons has enough depth to serve the greater purpose of the game without being overwrought or limiting. In fact, major credit to the developers for allowing the player to downgrade a previously upgraded weapon and assign the upgrade points to a different weapon at no penalty. This flexibility really encourages the player to try various play styles and strategies mission to mission, which really keeps things fresh.

As for the main course, the shooting is satisfying, the controls are sublime, and the enemies are nicely varied in both attack and defense. Visually, the user interface and menus are well done and easy to navigate. While the in-game graphics may lack a lot of flash, the minimalist kind of look works well here in spite of the abundance of brown. Overall, I have really enjoyed my early play time with Sector Six and I envision spending quite a bit more with it, especially if the replay value is as good as I think it will be.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Sector six in all is a great Game. It has its issues but it can make up for them with the fast and enjoying gameplay. I was a beta tester and the game had its few bugs but hopefully on May 2nd when it comes out all of those will be resolved.  The latest update that I have resived had fixed most of the bugs. (Gameplay) In sector six you are a ship fighting other ships pritty much but theres more to the story than that. The game is so large that iv had Sector Six for Near 2 weeks and iv still not finished it. The levels are long and require a bit of of time to get used to them. If you dont prepare your self you will die. (ShipBuilding) Sector Six has an amazing ship building engine. I am a dev my self and have never seen a Gamemaker Studios game with a Building Engine like that.  You can build huge ships and small ships with loads of weapons. (Enemys) Theres loads of differnt types of enemys. from little buggeres to huge ♥♥♥ Laser Burning, Missile Firing, Massive Stations.
(Performance)Sector six is an amazing game but peformance can ruin a game, luckly sector six runs well on your average pc. The software used to make Sector Six is Gamemaker studios. Its an easy software to use but it leans more towards cpu than graphics cards. On my Terrible pc test I used a old pc I found in a scrap Yard (Im not joking). It ran on windows vista and had a intel pentium 1.84 ghz prossesor and 2Gb of onboard ram. The game ran Well with a few frame rate drops. But one thing stood out, The Cpu usage. the terrible pc used 89.4 percent of the cpu so I would not open any other applications or you could have a big frame rate drop. On my IMac 2011 core I5 21.5 Inch running windows 10 it Ran flawless with 29.7% Cpu usage and on my costom pc it ran 21.6% of the cpu. Sector Six only takes on average 132 Mbs of ram So its good for low ram users.

This was a review from the whole FusionTurtle Team. Hope to see the next Game zurrix my old friend. As a fellow dev I wish you all the luck on your next game

reviewText:
Early Access Review

- I do not have a  recommendation as of May 3 2016 (do not read what I have rated above- { WAIT UP} Sector Six  a indie game made by a 1 man army, Zuurix
What I called a bullet-hell Space Shooter
Early Access Game-Released on 2nd Of May 2016
Played since Beta

//Background
Unique experience while playing this game, everything about this game is very unqiue as in its very rare to see a game similar to this: Unique  GamePlay: The gameplay consists of controlling a ship with customizable controls in a tunnel like area (meaning you can not go over the screen-top or bottom) Unique Enviromen/background : The background of this game is like a sci-fi matrix prison sort of thing, I haven't seen very much games that are like this its art style is basic but amazing at the same time :)

Pros

My Opinion as of may 3 2016

Smooth Controls
Nice Feel
Very unqiue experience- can not really find it anywhere else
Very rewarding when you kill the enemy
alot of replay abilty
alot of abilites
very suppourtive community with a AMAZING (big emphasis on this) Dev just amazing I know this guy for a little while now and he is just a amazing dev who inspires everyone who he meets and presents it in his game
Updates very regulary and you can expect that to happen for a long time
SHIP CUSTOMIZATIONS OMGGGGG

Cons:

My Opinon as of may 3rd 2016

I am not being a ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ with this cons I am just puting my opinon out their and if you feel to discuss anything or argue go ahed/correct me I will appreciate it!! also this is a early access game


Story Very Short, Not really interesting- not engaging enough
Enemy Ai Can be very predictable at times ( the more you play through) and sometimes very bad
Fps very clunky sometimes dips on cut-scenes and when starting/finishing missons or randomly
Menu sometimes clunky-unresponcive
Bad Optimization Issues when recording the fps drops very low!
Optimization issues?
Sometimes can be very easy or very hard
Some Abilties need to be reworked, for example the shield really makes your ship really op and not even fun to go up against.
When starting the game their are some bugs? I can skip missons by avoiding the ships

Conclusion
Saying all this things I am sure the dev will fix most of this issue soon,and all the cons are not really game-changing and for $10 this game is amazing with the very unqiue gameplay that you can not find anywhere else this game will be a very soul-ful experience in addition to the constant updates from the dev this game will be amazing (it alerdy is) trust me I saw this game before beta and it was good then BUT IT HAS IMRPOVED ALOT FROM THEN i cant wait for the updates for this game!!! its just getting better, for $10-7 Your getting a game that you can play for more then 40hours which is just amazing because most movies cost $12 and give you only 1-3 hours of entertainment!!!! I was close to recommending this game but I would wait just a little bit for zuurix to get dem updates XD but get this game now everyone and start playing !!!
